intro: Malesherbia breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered malesherbia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in dry, arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts.
